item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18850)
item.content:encoded:

Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúColorado law now requires law enforcement officers to stop...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúColorado law now requires law enforcement officers to stop other officers from using excessive force, or report it after it happens.

Otherwise, it is a crime.‚Äù

Marshall Zelinger 9News

The case stemmed from an August 2020 arrest and what happened in the jail afterward.

9news.com

Colorado's first 'failure to intervene' case led to $300,000 settlement

The case stemmed from an August 2020 arrest and what happened in the jail afterward.The case stemmed from an August 2020 arrest and what happened in the jail afterward.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúAs of Friday morning, Denver ranks No. 9 on the global list...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúAs of Friday morning, Denver ranks No. 9 on the global list of air quality and pollution.‚Äù The Denver Post

It is no secret that Denver‚Äôs air quality has been bad this past month. But if you look at how it compares on a global scale, you might be surprised on how high the city ranks.

denverpost.com

Denver ranks among the most polluted cities in the world

It is no secret that Denver‚Äôs air quality has been bad this past month. But if you look at how it compares on a global scale, you might be surprised on how high the city ranks.It is no secret that Denver‚Äôs air quality has been bad this past month. But if you look at how it compares on a global scale, you might be surprised on how high the city ranks.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôve seen is that our police accountability bill is...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôve seen is that our police accountability bill is working. Officers are being charged under SB217, whether it‚Äôs for excessive use of force in the field or failure to intervene when excessive force.‚Äù

Colorado Public Radio

Colorado's police reform law requires cops to intervene when another officer uses force and, so far, five have faced consequences.

cpr.org

It‚Äôs Early, But Colorado‚Äôs Police Reform Efforts Have Already Resulted In Charges For Officers

Colorado's police reform law requires cops to intervene when another officer uses force and, so far, five have faced consequences.Colorado's police reform law requires cops to intervene when another officer uses force and, so far, five have faced consequences.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Recently preliminary redistricting maps were released for...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Recently preliminary redistricting maps were released for Colorado‚Äôs state House and Senate. Though we have been assured that these maps will change over time, the approach used to draw the new lines is deeply troubling.

The Denver Post

The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as ‚Äúcracking‚Äù during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

Herod and Bacon: Colorado‚Äôs Black Caucus has big concerns about redistricting maps

The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as ‚Äúcracking‚Äù during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie‚Ä¶The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as ‚Äúcracking‚Äù during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie‚Ä¶

item.title: "It is clear here that they exercised that authority...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It is clear here that they exercised that authority inappropriately and contrary to the needs of the community by allowing an officer with a long history of misconduct across two states for both use of force and deceptive behavior,‚Äù Brown said of the POST decision in Geiger‚Äôs case, adding the board‚Äôs exemption power creates a ‚Äúloophole‚Äù in officer discipline that he believes should be legislatively closed.‚Äù

Denver7

Two years after Jon Geiger‚Äôs conviction, the state‚Äôs Peace Officer Standards and Training Board reinstated Geiger ‚Äî exercising its power, in certain circumstances, to exempt officers convicted of crimes from being decertified.

thedenverchannel.com

Colorado police officer re-certified despite guilty plea

Two years after Jon Geiger‚Äôs conviction, the state‚Äôs Peace Officer Standards and Training Board reinstated Geiger ‚Äî exercising its power, in certain circumstances, to exempt officers convicted of crimes from being decertified.Two years after Jon Geiger‚Äôs conviction, the state‚Äôs Peace Officer Standards and Training Board reinstated Geiger ‚Äî exercising its power, in certain circumstances, to exempt officers convicted of crimes from being decertified.

item.title: ‚ÄúBetween March 2020 and the end of December, Denver reported...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúBetween March 2020 and the end of December, Denver reported just under seven COVID-19 cases per 100 people, but that number masked huge variation in who was actually getting sick.‚Äù

The Denver Post

A new map from the Colorado Health Institute shows the number of coronavirus cases compared to population in neighborhoods from Douglas County to Weld County, and reveals poorer neighborhoods had m‚Ä¶

Denver‚Äôs blue-collar neighborhoods hit hard by COVID, while wealthier areas were largely spared

item.title: For the first time, Denver has approved a permit to allow people...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

For the first time, Denver has approved a permit to allow people living in their cars to park overnight in a designated area.

Denverite

The First Universalist Church parking lot will allow up to eight cars.

denverite.com

Denver OKs the city's first safe parking space for people living in their cars

The First Universalist Church parking lot will allow up to eight cars.The First Universalist Church parking lot will allow up to eight cars.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs our business model,‚Äù Danesh said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs our business model,‚Äù Danesh said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre family. You‚Äôre coming into my house and I‚Äôm your host. It‚Äôs amazing how fast you can build relationships when you actually truly start hearing people and talking to them.‚Äù

üíú love this place üíú

Familiarity and avocado toast helped Veronica Hudson over the last year -- here's the first business a Denverite reader sent us to celebrate for this series.

denverite.com

Park Hill's Honey Hill Cafe served as a 'third place' through uncertainty and isolation

Familiarity and avocado toast helped Veronica Hudson over the last year -- here's the first business a Denverite reader sent us to celebrate for this series.Familiarity and avocado toast helped Veronica Hudson over the last year -- here's the first business a Denverite reader sent us to celebrate for this series.

item.title: "In legislative politics, there is a perception that...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In legislative politics, there is a perception that politicians must choose between getting things done and risking losing an election or slowing down to hold on to power. From the results of the last two elections and this legislative session, Democrats are looking to prove that to be a false choice in the minds of Colorado voters. We‚Äôll know if they were right or wrong in 2022."

What are your thoughts? Can Democrats be both both and victorious?

https://www.denverpost.com/‚Ä¶/colorado-democrats-2021-state‚Ä¶/

In 2022, the GOP will likely spend a few million bucks going after Democrats on new and increased fees or create a race-based boogeyman about Democrats being soft on crime. There‚Äôs no indication th‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

Silverii: Colorado Democrats went big in 2021. Will they pay in 2022?

In 2022, the GOP will likely spend a few million bucks going after Democrats on new and increased fees or create a race-based boogeyman about Democrats being soft on crime. There‚Äôs no indication th‚Ä¶In 2022, the GOP will likely spend a few million bucks going after Democrats on new and increased fees or create a race-based boogeyman about Democrats being soft on crime. There‚Äôs no indication th‚Ä¶

item.title: WASHINGTON ‚Äî ‚ÄúSenate Democrats announced Tuesday that they...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

WASHINGTON ‚Äî ‚ÄúSenate Democrats announced Tuesday that they have reached a budget agreement among themselves that envisions spending an enormous $3.5 trillion over the coming decade. The fiscal plan would pave the way for Democrats‚Äô drive to direct a huge pool of federal resources at climate change, health care and family-service programs sought by President Joe Biden.‚Äù

The Denver Post

Senate Democrats announced Tuesday that they have reached a budget agreement among themselves that envisions spending an enormous $3.5 trillion over the coming decade. The fiscal plan would pave th‚Ä¶

Senate Democrats announce $3.5 trillion budget agreement

item.title: ‚ÄúThroughout the pandemic, Black churches across America have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúThroughout the pandemic, Black churches across America have played a key role in reducing vaccine hesitancy. Now, faith leaders want to do more, shifting their focus to other health issues in hopes they can reduce disparities within the Black and brown community.‚Äù Denver7

Black church leaders say they've long known their members sometimes put their trust in places of faith, even over medical professionals. Now, after addressing vaccine hesitancy after the pandemic, they've formed initiatives to help tackle other medical issues and health disparities.

thedenverchannel.com

Black church plays key role in reducing health disparities within communities of color

Black church leaders say they've long known their members sometimes put their trust in places of faith, even over medical professionals. Now, after addressing vaccine hesitancy after the pandemic, they've formed initiatives to help tackle other medical issues and health disparities.Black church leaders say they've long known their members sometimes put their trust in places of faith, even over medical professionals. Now, after addressing vaccine hesitancy after the pandemic, they've formed initiatives to help tackle other medical issues and health disparities.

item.title: Representative Leslie HerodThe move would be an attempt to become national symbols in the fight for voting rights, as Republicans in the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie HerodThe move would be an attempt to become national symbols in the fight for voting rights, as Republicans in the state move ahead with a bill that would impose new limits on casting a ballot.

nytimes.com

Texas Democrats Plan to Flee State to Highlight G.O.P. Voting Restrictions

The move would be an attempt to become national symbols in the fight for voting rights, as Republicans in the state move ahead with a bill that would impose new limits on casting a ballot.The move would be an attempt to become national symbols in the fight for voting rights, as Republicans in the state move ahead with a bill that would impose new limits on casting a ballot.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie HerodNew information from the University of Colorado Denver shows the Mile High City is among the top gay-friendly cities in the country.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Denver Among Top Same Sex Couple-Friendly Cities In The Country, Data Shows

New information from the University of Colorado Denver shows the Mile High City is among the top gay-friendly cities in the country.New information from the University of Colorado Denver shows the Mile High City is among the top gay-friendly cities in the country.

item.title: ‚ÄúGov. Jared Polis indefinitely prohibited the use of ketamine...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

‚ÄúGov. Jared Polis indefinitely prohibited the use of ketamine outside of hospital settings for people experiencing ‚Äúexcited delirium‚Äù as he signed into law a bill limiting when the powerful sedative can be used in situations involving law enforcement.

House Bill 1251 was inspired by the death of Elijah McClain, a 23-year-old Black man who died after an encounter with Aurora police officers and paramedics in 2019. During the encounter, McClain was given ketamine in a dose his family said was far too large for his size.‚Äù

The Colorado Sun

Gov. Jared Polis indefinitely prohibited the use of ketamine outside of hospital settings for people experiencing ‚Äúexcited delirium‚Äù as he signed into law a bill limiting when the powerful sedative can be used in situations involving law enforcement. House Bill 1251 was inspired by the death of ...

coloradosun.com

Colorado governor signs wave of criminal justice bills into law, including ketamine measure spurred by Elijah McClain‚Äôs death

Gov. Jared Polis indefinitely prohibited the use of ketamine outside of hospital settings for people experiencing ‚Äúexcited delirium‚Äù as he signed into law a bill limiting when the powerful sedative can be used in situations involving law enforcement. House Bill 1251 was inspired by the death of ...Gov. Jared Polis indefinitely prohibited the use of ketamine outside of hospital settings for people experiencing ‚Äúexcited delirium‚Äù as he signed into law a bill limiting when the powerful sedative can be used in situations involving law enforcement. item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.‚Äù

- 5280 Magazine

...

üì∏ Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.

5280.com

State Representative Leslie Herod Has a Story to Share | 5280

Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.
item.author: Leslie Herod
